text:
Hi <@U02SR6E8Z9S> <@U03QSP8LP9T>, I've been playing around with Quickstart in the last few day (Licensing app, Wallet, Keycloak, etc) trying to grab the idea of building the app and I hit a newbie issue: I used Keycloak to add a couple of new users, then login to the wallet for onboarding and grab some CC from the tap. I have the impression that once I have the CC I will be able to send to another user that I create previously, but on the Transfer page the Recipient box only shows `sv.sv.cns` (screenshot 1), and if I type the username in the box (for example `alh` ) the transfer request won't happen. Also if I log in to the licensing app with this new user and pay the Renewal payment request, it redirect me to the wallet page, log in, but unable to show the payment button (screenshot 2, 3. Another thing I notice that the new user party ids have different naming compare to the existing app_user party (screenshot 4). I know it must be something wrong in the process but can't figure out what it is. Hope you guys can point me to the right direction.
CC <@U07UEV3B9LP> <@U0735T8NZFE> <@U094KF3PKDY>

Another thing I notice that the new user party ids have different naming compare to the existing app_user party (screenshot 4). I know it must be something wrong in the process but can't figure out what it is. Hope you guys can point me to the right direction.
CC

text:
Hi <@U03HMUTQ5F0>

*I have few questions regarding "reverting" and "transfer expiration"* 

1. I could not find the exact expiration time, The whitepaper states that the "lease time" for aborting a stuck transaction is "known domain-wide". Is this time fixed duration or based on blocks?
2. Is there an API endpoint we can query to fetch this value?
3. Once the transaction is expired, is the process of funds going back into the Sender party's address automatic or there is an additional step?
4. If a sender proposes a transaction, can they manually cancel it _before_ the lease time expires, or must they wait for the timeout? If so, what is the process?

elements.text: Hi
I have few questions regarding "reverting" and "transfer expiration"
I could not find the exact expiration time, The whitepaper states that the "lease time" for aborting a stuck transaction is "known domain-wide". Is this time fixed duration or based on blocks?
Is there an API endpoint we can query to fetch this value?
Once the transaction is expired, is the process of funds going back into the Sender party's address automatic or there is an additional step?
If a sender proposes a transaction, can they manually cancel it
before
the lease time expires, or must they wait for the timeout? If so, what is the process?

text:
*And few additional questions regarding account creation:*

1. The pre-approval delegation to "accept all incoming Canton Coin transfers from any party" on behalf of the user permanent? Or is this something the user would have to periodically re-approve?
2. If a user delegates receive-acceptance to Validator's node, what is the exact process for them to later revoke this permission? Is this a simple on-chain transaction we can build a UI for in the account settings? (Just for understanding)
3. The onboarding flow mentions creating a party and registering mappings like `PartyToKeyMapping`. Does setting the pre-approval delegation require a separate, subsequent transaction, or can it be batched with the initial party creation? 
cc: <@U03HMUTQ5F0> <@U03PEUXABF1>

PartyToKeyMapping
. Does setting the pre-approval delegation require a separate, subsequent transaction, or can it be batched with the initial party creation?

text:
> 1. The pre-approval delegation to "accept all incoming Canton Coin transfers from any party" on behalf of the user permanent? Or is this something the user would have to periodically re-approve?
Yes, this is permanent until manually reverted

elements.text: The pre-approval delegation to "accept all incoming Canton Coin transfers from any party" on behalf of the user permanent? Or is this something the user would have to periodically re-approve?
Yes, this is permanent until manually reverted

text:
>  2. If a user delegates receive-acceptance to Validator's node, what is the exact process for them to later revoke this permission? Is this a simple on-chain transaction we can build a UI for in the account settings? (Just for understanding)
I believe you can revert this via a call to the ledger, but I'll need to confirm.

text:
The token standard allows the transfer to define an `executeBefore` date-time, and then then how the offer will be withdrawn.

`executeBefore` shows up here:
<https://docs.dev.sync.global/app_dev/api/splice-api-token-transfer-instruction-v1/Splice-Api-Token-TransferInstructionV1.html#type-splice-api-token-transferinstructionv1-transfer-51973|https://docs.dev.sync.global/app_dev/api/splice-api-token-transfer-instruction-v1/Splice-Api-Token-TransferInstructionV1.html#type-spli[…]sfer-51973>

Details on `TransferInstruction_Withdraw` here:
<https://docs.dev.sync.global/app_dev/api/splice-api-token-transfer-instruction-v1/Splice-Api-Token-TransferInstructionV1.html#type-splice-api-token-transferinstructionv1-transferinstructionwithdraw-43648|https://docs.dev.sync.global/app_dev/api/splice-api-token-transfer-instruction-v1/Splice-Api-Token-TransferInstructionV1.html#type-splice-api-token-transferinstructionv1-transferinstructionwithdraw-43648>.

There is no automatic rollback after `executeBefore` . In general, specific implementations can choose how to withdraw a proposed transfer.
